title: The Masked Singer Australia 'secret salaries are revealed' ahead of the grand finale
text:
The Masked Singer Australia will crown its first winner on Monday night.

But it appears some of the 12 mystery stars profited more than others from their appearance on the quirky signing contest.

In a list compiled by Woman's Day, Nikki Webster (the Alien) was reportedly paid the least at $10,000, while a mystery finalist is said to be earning a whopping $380,000.

Can YOU guess which star was paid $380,000? The Masked Singer Australia's 'secret salaries' have been revealed ahead of the grand finale. Pictured: host Osher Günsberg

According to the magazine, each celebrity was paid between $10,000 and $200,000 as a sign-on fee, with some stars paid more depending on how many episodes they appeared on.

With Nikki being out of the spotlight in recent years, it would make sense for her to be paid less compared to established artists, sportspeople or media personalities.

The highest-paid female was apparently singer Kate Ceberano (the Lion), who received a $70,000 sign-on fee and an additional $5,000-per-episode bonus.

Star appeal: Each celebrity was paid between $10,000 and $200,000 as a sign-on fee, with some stars paid more depending on how many episodes they appeared on

Meanwhile, Deni Hines (the Unicorn) and Gretel Killeen (the Octopus) both received a $20,000 sign-on fee, while Paulini Curuenavuli (the Spider) was paid $25,000.

On average, the show's male participants earned more than their female co-stars.

Darren McMullen (the Prawn) was paid $20,000 to sign on, Brett Lee (the Parrot) was given $40,000, Adam Brand (the Dragon) earned $30,000 and Wendell Sailor (the Rhino) received $15,000.

Interestingly one of the popular female finalists, the Monster, was offered one of the lowest sign-on fees of $15,000.

Not equal: In a list compiled by Woman's Day, Nikki Webster (left) was reportedly paid the least at $10,000, while Kate Ceberano (right) was the highest-paid female at $90,000

The other two finalists, Wolf and Robot, were reportedly given $50,000 and $200,000 respectively to join the reality show.

It has been widely speculated that the Robot is Cody Simpson, and Woman's Day claims he was given a $30,000 bonus for each of the six episodes he appeared on.

If correct, this means Cody will take home $380,000 by the end of the season.

An industry expert said: 'Even though [Cody] is relatively unknown in Australia, he's considered very high on the U.S. food chain and it would have taken at least that much to get Cody over here for the show.'

Top earner: Cody Simpson (pictured with his girlfriend Miley Cyrus) will reportedly earn $380,000 by the end of the season

Cha-ching! Lindsay Lohan is believed to be the highest earner out of the judges with a $800,000 paycheck, while Dannii Minogue, Jackie 'O' Henderson and Dave Hughes are being paid around $400,000 each

Woman's Day reported that the judges were also taking home a decent paycheck.

Hollywood star Lindsay Lohan is believed to be earning $800,000, while Dannii Minogue, Jackie 'O' Henderson and Dave Hughes are being paid around $400,000 each.

The Masked Singer Australia's finale airs Monday at 7.30pm on Channel 10
description: In a list compiled by Woman's Day, the Alien (Nikki Webster) was reportedly paid the least at $10,000, while a mystery finalist is said to be earning a whopping $380,000
authors: Candice Jackson For Daily Mail Australia
